row are different here for most patterns row are traditionally done as each way is one row… so in a normal pattern your foundation chain is row one you turn skip the first stitch and work row 2… in my patterns a row is a forward and backward pass… so row one is now both the foundation row the turn and the return pass why to make it easier to keep track of your row now you can use a stitch marker up one side and know exactly which row you are on i break down the forward and the backward pass by indenting you ll always start your row on the tail side… making it easier to put your project down if you ever get confused just reach out to me or simply mark every new line as a row to be more in line with traditional patterns after teaching for years this newer method has helped beginner crocheters
